Package game

Class Player

java.lang.Object
game.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
The game player is represented by an object of this class.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player()
    Creates a new player named "Steve" and starting health of 100.
    Player(String name)
    Creates a new player with the given name and starting health of 100.
    Player(String name, int health)
    Creates a new player with the given name and the given health value.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(String name, Item item)
      Adds the given item with the given name to the player's inventory. Player will use the name to refer to the item. Use this method to create an alias for an item already in the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      name - name of item
      item - item to add

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Item item)
      Adds the given item to the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - item to add

      Returns:
      item with the given name

      name - name of item to remove

    • clearInventory

      public void clearInventory()
      Removes all items from the player's inventory.

      public boolean has(String name)
      Returns true if the player has an item with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - name of item
      Returns:
      true if player has the item

    • getEquipped

      public String getEquipped()
      Returns the name of the equipped weapon. Returns null if there is no equipped weapon.
      Returns:
      name of equipped weapon, or null

      public boolean reduceHealth(int thisMuch)
      Lowers this player's health by the given value.
      Parameters:
      thisMuch - amount to reduce health by
      Returns:
      true if player's health remains above zero
